wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement News Roundup 10/09/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

BSR and the State of Corporate Responsibility

With 440 diverse companies included in the recent report State of Sustainable Business from Business for Social Responsibility (BSR) and GlobeScan, the report represents one of the most robust surveys of today’s largest and most influential companies. Although the report celebrates the accomplishments these companies have participated in to improve sustainable efforts across the globe, this article questions some business’ intentions behind these initiatives and encourages consumers to get more involved in the conversation.

Federal CFO: How CFOs Can Improve Employee Engagement

In an interview with Dr. David Dye, director of Human Capital at Deloitte Consulting LLP, he discusses why many leaders in the private and public sector struggle to improve employee engagement. He also suggests how federal CFOs can drive, measure and create value with their employee engagement efforts. As this has become a top priority for leaders across every industry, David outlines five key elements to creating a successful program including hands-on management, gaining trust in leadership, cultivating a positive work environment, enabling meaningful work, and opportunities for employee growth.

5 Things Your Employees Aren’t Telling You But You Need to Know

Employees may be reluctant to share how they really feel about their organization and role for numerous reasons. The article provides insight into their thinking and how to create a more open environment that empowers employees to share. The author explains that employees crave meaningful relationships, to be trusted, and have opportunities for growth and meaningful work, which she explains, starts at the top.

How Corporate Governance Affects Corporate Sustainability and Why It Matters

Corporate governance has been increasingly tied to corporate activities such as the impact on society and the environment. Naturally, this can create tension among major players such as c-level execs, board members, and shareholders, as it requires a new way of thinking (and most often added responsibility) when it comes to corporate responsibility. This article explains why it is important to define each key player’s role to better understand and share in sustainability responsibility and outcomes.

The Best Ways to Reward Employees

This article explains the importance of having a strategic reward system in place that recognizes employee action in the form of performance and behavior. However, to guarantee it is effective and well-respected, it must align with the company’s core values and strategies. In the past, most companies believed compensation should be at the forefront of their rewards system, yet this author shows how low cost options’such as recognition and appreciation’may be the secret tool to scale impact.
